alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Preble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 10:56PM EDT until September 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southwest Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Southwest Ohio, Butler. In West Central Ohio, Montgomery and Preble. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1056 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Trotwood, Englewood, Eaton, Camden, Lewisburg, New Paris, West Alexandria, Gratis, Clayton, Union, Brookville, Germantown, New Lebanon, Farmersville, Phillipsburg, Verona, Somerville, West Elkton, Wheatville and Oklahoma.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
